ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]This TED Talk Is Full of Bad Ideas | Gabe Whaley | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: This TED Talk Is Full of Bad Ideas | Gabe Whaley | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
What if the worst ideas turned out to be the most interesting? Mischief-making artist Gabe Whaley shares how he built a collective of artists whose seemingly bad ideas â€” like selling 5,000 keys to the same car â€” often go viral and sell for thousands of dollars. His playful experiments show why itâ€™s worth leaning into the absurd â€¦ because you never know what might happen. (Recorded at TED2025 on April 9, 2025)
Join us in person at a TED conference: https://tedtalks.social/events Become a TED Member to support our mission: https://ted.com/membership Subscribe to a TED newsletter: https://ted.com/newsletters
Follow TED! X: https://www.twitter.com/TEDTalks Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ted Facebook: https://facebook.com/TED LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ted-conferences TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@tedtoks
The TED Talks channel features talks, performances and original series from the world's leading thinkers and doers. Subscribe to our channel for videos on Technology, Entertainment and Design â€” plus science, business, global issues, the arts and more. Visit https://TED.com to get our entire library of TED Talks, transcripts, translations, personalized talk recommendations and more.
Watch more: https://go.ted.com/gabewhaley
https://youtu.be/hn3vHUpIyhE

ns2:group.ns2:title: OpenAI Codex in your code editor
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Use Codex right in your code editor with the new IDE extension for VS Code, Cursor and other forks.
In this video, Gabriel Peal and Romain Huet show you how to explore code, implement new features, and brainstorm front-end design ideas for their app.
Timestamps:
00:00 Intro 00:45 Exploring the codebase 01:20 Implementing hover states 02:40 Moving tasks to Codex cloud 03:23 Brainstorming new designs with Codex 04:20 How Codex changed Gabrielâ€™s workflow 05:30 Reviewing Codexâ€™s work
Try it yourself:
VS Code: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=openai.chatgpt
Cursor, Windsurf, others: search OpenAI Codex in the extension directory
Learn more: Codex: openai.com/codex Developer docs: developers.openai.com/codex Code for OpenAI.fm: https://github.com/openai/openai-fm

ns2:group.ns2:title: My dog lost 19 pounds!
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Five years ago, Ellie began to slow down. Sheâ€™d nap more, skip walks, and we figured she was just getting older.
Then the vet told us Ellie was overweight, which was crazy because we didnâ€™t even realize it.
It turns out she was part of the 59% of adult dogs who are overweight or obese, which can shorten a dogâ€™s life by up to two and a half years. That was a huge wake-up call for us.
We took a closer look at what we were feeding her and realized her old kibble was ultra-processed and missing the nutrients she needed. That moment set us on a path to find something healthier that actually fit our lifestyle.
Spot & Tangoâ€™s UnKibble has been that solution. Ellieâ€™s lost 19 pounds, her energy is off the charts, and sheâ€™s truly living her happiest and healthiest life.
If your dog could benefit from losing a few pounds or youâ€™re simply looking to make a positive change, UnKibble is a great place to start. The promo GOLDEN will save you 60% off your first order.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [The Verge]AI can't even turn on the lights | The Vergecast

ns2:group.ns2:title: AI can't even turn on the lights | The Vergecast
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Nilayâ€™s back! And you can listen to The Vergecast with no ads, if youâ€™re a Verge subscriber! Big week, really. Nilay and David start the show by talking about ads, podcasts, platforms, and subscriptions. Then they talk a bunch about Appleâ€™s new M5-powered MacBook, iPad, and Vision Pro, and whether a chip bump is worth getting excited about. After that, Nilay reflects on a summer of using AI products, and explains why you can tell the whole story of this generation of AI just by talking about the smart home. Finally, in the lightning round, the hosts talk about AI song covers, Apple TV, TiVo, Roku, Cybertrucks, and the exploding Pixel 10 Pro Fold. #Vergecast #Podcast #Technology
0:00 Nilay Returns! 03:02 Tech Upgrades and Smart Home Adventures 10:59 Ad-Free Podcasts and Subscription Insights 18:45 Apple's New Product Announcements 32:47 The Future of Augmented Reality 34:21 Technological Hurdles in AR Development 35:19 Concerns About Privacy and Content Moderation 40:11 The AI Bubble and Financial Implications 42:10 Limitations of LLMs in Smart Home Assistants 45:50 Challenges in AI and Smart Home Integration 48:32 The Reality of AI in Consumer Products 50:05 The Disconnect Between AI Hype and Reality 56:35 The Struggle of Major Tech Companies with AI 01:04:02 User Frustrations with AI and Smart Home Devices 01:07:07 The Future of AI in Everyday Life 01:09:01 OpenAI's Guardrails and Mature Content 01:09:41 Sam Altman's Clarification on X 01:10:30 AI Girlfriends and the Sticky Business 01:13:26 The Slippery Slope of Content Moderation 01:14:34 AI-Generated Content and Its Implications 01:17:18 The Lightning Round 01:18:29 AI-Generated Music and Cultural Appropriation 01:23:13 Streaming Services and Branding Decisions 01:27:25 The End of TiVo and TV Hardware Innovations 01:32:11 Tesla Cybertruck Sales and Controversies 01:34:35 Pixel 10 Pro Fold Drama 01:39:20 Conclusion and Upcoming Episodes

It can look at whatâ€™s on your screen, understand what youâ€™re pointing at, and even answer questions using vision. This is the future of Windows AI, and itâ€™s kind of wild to experience firsthand.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Agentic AI in Action: Turning Data into Outcomes | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Agentic AI in Action: Turning Data into Outcomes | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Explore the transformative power of agentic AI with AWS Executives in Residence Tom Soderstrom and Miriam McLemore as they reveal how organizations can turn overwhelming data volume into actionable business outcomes. Drawing from their extensive experience leading digital transformation at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory and Coca-Cola respectively, our experts share practical insights on overcoming data paralysis, breaking down organizational silos, and implementing a culture of experimentation. From Formula 1's ruthless prioritization of data insights to NASA's global data sharing strategy, this episode provides real-world data success stories and essential guidance for business and IT leaders navigating the intersection of structured and unstructured data in the era of generative and agentic AI.
Learn more about Executive Insights: http://go.aws/47bKatA
Subscribe to AWS: https://go.aws/subscribe
Create a free AWS account: https://go.aws/signup Try AWS for free: https://go.aws/free Connect with an expert: https://go.aws/contact Explore more: https://go.aws/more

Do you have technical AWS questions? Ask the community of experts on AWS re:Post: https://go.aws/3lPaoPb
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services is the worldâ€™s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud, enabling customers to build anything they can imagine. We offer the greatest choice of innovative cloud capabilities and expertise, on the most extensive global infrastructure with industry-leading security, reliability, and performance.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [TED]How We Took On an Oil Giant â€” and Won | Melinda Janki | TED

ns2:group.ns2:title: How We Took On an Oil Giant â€” and Won | Melinda Janki | TED
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Oil companies may seem invincible, but they are more vulnerable than you think, says climate justice litigator Melinda Janki. She tells the story of how she took on ExxonMobil in her home country of Guyana, notching historic wins against the oil giant â€” and proving that we can turn existing laws into powerful tools for change. (Recorded at TED Countdown Summit 2025 on June 18, 2025)
Countdown is TED's global initiative to accelerate solutions to the climate crisis. The goal: to build a better future by cutting greenhouse gas emissions in half by 2030, in the race to a zero-carbon world. Get involved at https://countdown.ted.com
Join us in person at a TED conference: https://tedtalks.social/events Become a TED Member to support our mission: https://ted.com/membership Subscribe to a TED newsletter: https://ted.com/newsletters
Follow TED! X: https://www.twitter.com/TEDTalks Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ted Facebook: https://facebook.com/TED LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/ted-conferences TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@tedtoks
The TED Talks channel features talks, performances and original series from the world's leading thinkers and doers. Subscribe to our channel for videos on Technology, Entertainment and Design â€” plus science, business, global issues, the arts and more. Visit https://TED.com to get our entire library of TED Talks, transcripts, translations, personalized talk recommendations and more.
Watch more: https://go.ted.com/melindajanki
https://youtu.be/Pj5jM6MANUo

ns2:group.ns2:title: The Big Picture: AI, Machine Learning, and Neural Networks
ns2:group.ns2:description:
ML models need solid infrastructure to run in production. Grab our DevOps Roadmap to learn the foundational skills that power modern AI systems: https://bit.ly/ai-to-devops-roadmap
#machinelearning #machinelearningmodels #aiexplained
â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ Thanks Warp for making this video possible ğŸ™Œ â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬â–¬ â–º Warp is the fastest way to build with multiple AI agent â–º Warp is free to use, but you can now try Warp Pro free for 7 days which gives you 2,500 AI creditsâ€”no card required. Use my link â†’ https://go.warp.dev/nana
In this video, we're diving into something that's absolutely transforming our digital landscape: AI, Machine Learning, Neural Networks and Deep Learning. And we are gonna demystify every single one of these terms, all the confusing buzzwords and tech terms like supervised learning, reinforcement learning, all of them once and for all.
By the end of this Machine Learning explained video, you'll understand not just what these concepts are, but how they're reshaping our digital world - and why they are soo powerful and exciting.
So let's get started and demystify the world of artificial intelligence!

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Kendra's Language School]English Dialogue Listening Practice | Finally Catch Every Word

ns2:group.ns2:title: English Dialogue Listening Practice | Finally Catch Every Word
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Repeatedly listen to the pronunciation of native speakers, and it will really improve your listening level!
The recording will be played three times in total. First, it will be played twice, and you can guess what the recording is about. Then the recording will be played twice, and the subtitles will be displayed on the screen, so you can check the answers.
Useful English Listening Practice for Basic Conversation Phrases https://youtu.be/YiuiYy47Rnc
Elementary English Listening Practice: Sharpen Your Ears https://youtu.be/kaOtoPbY-DA
Efficient training of Spoken English listening https://youtu.be/f7Sg3Wjpd14

In todayâ€™s video, Iâ€™m diving deep into the 2025 Canton Fair to explore some of the most exciting innovations on display â€” from cutting-edge consumer electronics and high-tech process machinery, to powerful agricultural equipment and the rise of service robots that are reshaping how industries operate. Along the way, Iâ€™ll be chatting to exhibitors, discovering how Chinaâ€™s manufacturers are pushing boundaries and redefining whatâ€™s possible.
Every year, hundreds of thousands of buyers from all over the world descend on Guangzhou for one reason â€” to see whatâ€™s next in global manufacturing. This is the Canton Fair â€” the worldâ€™s largest trade show, and if you want to understand where the future of business is heading, this is where youâ€™ll find the answers.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]SplashMusic composes smarter with AWS Trainium | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: SplashMusic composes smarter with AWS Trainium | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
By leveraging AWS Trainium, SplashMusic has optimized generative AI music training, enabling everyday moments to be transformed into unique musical compositions. They achieved an 8.6% increase in training throughput while reducing costs by over 55%. This breakthrough empowers SplashMusic to scale personalized music creation more efficiently, accelerating innovation while ensuring business sustainability.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Tiktok optimizes privacy-enhanced media measurement with AWS Clean Rooms ML | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Tiktok optimizes privacy-enhanced media measurement with AWS Clean Rooms ML | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
TikTok is changing how businesses connect with customers, where 76% of users are likely to consider a brand after viewing content on their platform. Discover how TikTok helps advertisers reach more of their customers and enable a better view of campaign measurement using AWS Clean Rooms maching learning (ML) capabilites. Learn how TikTok uses AWS Clean Rooms to apply ML with their partners for audience targeting, look alike modeling, and lift measurement to optimize media investmentâ€”all without sharing data with one another.
AWS Clean Rooms ML helps you and your partners apply privacy-enhancing controls to safeguard your proprietary data and ML models while generating predictive insightsâ€”all without sharing or copying one anotherâ€™s raw data or models.
Learn more about AWS Clean Rooms: http://go.aws/4oqQhSa

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Iterable transforms AI-powered marketing campaign execution and targeting with AWS

ns2:group.ns2:title: Iterable transforms AI-powered marketing campaign execution and targeting with AWS
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Iterable is an AI-powered customer communication platform that enables marketers to connect with customers at crucial moments through easy-to-use tools and journey management capabilities. Discover how Iterable's AI Query Summary, powered by Amazon Bedrock, transforms complex data queries into natural language, allowing marketers to focus more on creating exceptional customer experiences. Learn how Iterable leverages multiple foundation models for enhanced security, flexibility, and development efficiency to build generative AI applications that drive deeper personalization in their marketing efforts using Amazon Bedrock.
Learn more about Amazon Bedrock: http://go.aws/46StyZ9

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Pinterest fuels ad monetization with privacy-enhanced ML in AWS Clean Rooms | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Pinterest fuels ad monetization with privacy-enhanced ML in AWS Clean Rooms | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Pinterest, a visual discovery platform serving over 570 million monthly active users, helps people find inspiration while processing billions of data points to fuel their advertising and monetization engine. Discover how Pinterest enables advertisers to measure campaign incrementality and track conversions without directly sharing sensitive user data between parties. Learn how Pinterest uses sophisticated machine learning models to analyze combined datasets while maintaining strict data governance and user privacy controls with privacy-preserving collaboration ML capabilities with AWS Clean Rooms.

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Ogury's enhances digital advertising with AI-powered persona targeting using AWS

ns2:group.ns2:title: Ogury's enhances digital advertising with AI-powered persona targeting using AWS
ns2:group.ns2:description:
Ogury pioneers personified advertising, powered by AWS, to help advertisers reach relevant audiences while tackling signal loss in a privacy-first digital advertising world. Discover how their solution, Ogury One, enables media agencies to instantly match their briefs with personas based on anonymized browsing patterns and behaviors, allowing advertisers to target audiences more effectively and optimize campaign results. Learn how Ogury used Amazon Bedrock foundation models and AI-powered automation to enhance control, predicatability, and improve response quality by 10%.
Learn more about Amazon Bedrock: http://go.aws/46StyZ9

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]Beyond the First Build: Muyiwa's Rise | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: Beyond the First Build: Muyiwa's Rise | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
In this inspiring follow-up story, we revisit Muyiwa Kolayemi, who we first met as a Platform Engineer at Slalom Build in 2023. Since then, Muyiwa has continued his impressive career growth, advancing to Senior Platform Engineer and establishing himself as a leader in platform engineering.
Watch as Muyiwa shares how he navigated his promotion path at Slalom Build, his approach to continuous learning, and how he's using his success to give back to the tech community, including teaching cloud fundamentals to students in Nigeria. Learn how he balances technical growth with increasing responsibilities and hear his advice for others building their careers in tech.
This video is part of our "Beyond the First Build" series, showcasing how cloud skills can lead to dynamic career opportunities and meaningful professional growth. Join us as we explore Brian's continued journey of resilience, learning, and success in the tech industry.
Watch Muyiwa's original story: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=06-ETgEEho4
Ready to start your builder journey? Join AWS Builder Center, where you can connect with builders who understand your journey, share solutions, and access content that accelerates your growth: http://go.aws/491pqra

ns0:entry.ns0:title: [Amazon Web Services]AWS DataSyncScale out architectures and best practices | Amazon Web Services

ns2:group.ns2:title: AWS DataSyncScale out architectures and best practices | Amazon Web Services
ns2:group.ns2:description:
AWS DataSync is a secure, online service that automates and accelerates moving data between other cloud providers, on premises, and AWS storage services. In this video, Specialist Solutions Architect Santhosh Arunuri will discuss the building blocks of a DataSync data transfer and walk through an overview of various methods to scale out DataSync transfers using multiple agents and multiple tasks to maximize usage of available network bandwidth while achieving higher data throughput, reducing overall migration timelines. The video will also cover best practices to consider prior to starting a large migration project.
Scale Out Blog: http://go.aws/4q8qa45 http://go.aws/4979FyX
